text: It may be that those who do most, dream most.
author: Stephen Butler Leacock

text: I like to listen. I have learned a great deal from listening carefully. Most people never listen.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: If you live to be 100, I hope I live to be 100 minus 1 day, so I never have to live without you.
author: Winnie the Pooh

text: A single rose can be my garden… a single friend, my world.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
author: Mark Twain

text: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: A friend is someone who understands your past, believes in your future, and accepts you just the way you are.
author: Unknown

text: Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.
author: James Baldwin

text: The most important thing in life is to learn how to give out love, and to let it come in.
author: Morrie Schwartz

text: I love you not because of who you are, but because of who I am when I am with you.
author: Roy Croft

text: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
author: George Sand

text: You know it's love when all you want is that person to be happy, even if you're not part of their happiness
author: Julia Roberts

text: At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.
author: Plato

text: There are more things to alarm us than to harm us, and we suffer more often in apprehension than reality.
author: Seneca

text: Don’t underestimate the value of Doing Nothing, of just going along, listening to all the things you can’t hear, and not bothering.
author: Winnie the Pooh

text: If you want happiness for an hour — take a nap. If you want happiness for a day — go fishing. If you want happiness for a year — inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime — help someone else.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: Too many people are thinking of security instead of opportunity. They seem to be more afraid of life than death.
author: James F. Byrnes

text: Of all the liars in the world, sometimes the worst are our own fears.
author: Rudyard Kipling

text: Fear: False Evidence Appearing Real.
author: Unknown

text: I am not afraid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today.
author: William Allen White

text: Laughter is poison to fear.
author: George R.R. Martin

text: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
author: Mark Twain

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Self-care is never a selfish act—it is simply good stewardship of the only gift I have, the gift I was put on earth to offer to others.
author: Parker Palmer

text: Don't waste your energy trying to change opinions … Do your thing, and don't care if they like it.
author: Tina Fey

text: I don't want everyone to like me; I should think less of myself if some people did.
author: Henry James
